Name: Lalith Athulathmudali
Notes: President of the Oxford Union ( 1958 ) ; a Sri Lankan politician ; killed by the Tamil Tigers in 1993

Name: Neal Blewett ( HF )
Notes: Member of the Australian House of Representatives ( 1977-1994 ) , Government Minister ( 1983-1994 ) , High Commissioner to the UK ( 1994-1998 )

Name: Joseph Clearihue
Notes: Canadian Rhodes scholar ; later became a member of the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia and a county court judge ; also chairman of the council of Victoria College , British Columbia ( which became the University of Victoria under his leadership )

Name: Don Baron Jayatilaka
Notes: Ceylonese statesman ( vice-chairman of the Board of Ministers , Leader of the State Council , and Minister for Home Affairs )

Name: Thomas Lloyd
Notes: Politician in the province of Pennsylvania

Name: Norman Manley ( HF )
Notes: A Rhodes scholar whose studies were interrupted by World War I ; Chief Minister of Jamaica ( 1955-1962 )

Name: P. T. Rajan
Notes: Chief Minister of Madras Presidency ( April - August 1936 )

Name: Harold Rushworth
Notes: Emigrated to New Zealand in 1923 , becoming an MP for the Country Party in 1928

Name: Pixley ka Isaka Seme
Notes: Founder member of the African National Congress

Name: Heather Wilson
Notes: Republican member of the US House of Representatives , representing New Mexico 's 1st congressional district ( June 1998 - January 2009 ) ; the first Jesus Old Member elected to the House
